Key Match Events: Jhonkensy Noel hit a dramatic pinch-hit game-tying two-run home run in the ninth inning of Game 3 of the American League Championship Series.
In Game 4, Noel's deep left field drive was caught at the warning track by Alex Verdugo, preventing another late-inning miracle.
David Fry's infield single in the eighth inning of Game 4 tied the game at 6-6 after a misplay by Yankees reliever Mark Leiter Jr.
Emmanuel Clase allowed two runs in the top of the ninth inning of Game 4.
In the bottom of the ninth inning of Game 4, a walk by Noel and a single by Andrés Giménez brought the go-ahead run to the plate before Yankees reliever Tommy Kahnle sealed the victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt commented on Noel's near-miss in Game 4, noting it was about five feet short from hitting off the wall.
Catcher Austin Hedges expressed confidence despite the Guardians' backs being against the wall, emphasizing the team's belief in each other.
Yankees slugger Giancarlo Stanton acknowledged the Guardians' resiliency and the need for every player on the Yankees to contribute.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians have a history of fighting back, having overcome a 6-2 deficit to tie Game 4.
The Guardians previously faced elimination in the AL Division Series against the Tigers and prevailed in five games.
